docs.snippet: THE protest recently by automobile owners in Rio de Janeiro against a decree requiring the mixture of gasoline and alcohol lends point to a situation by no means confined to Brazil. It seems that, under pressure of economic necessity, and with the...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE protest recently by automobile owners in Rio de Janeiro against a decree requiring the mixture of gasoline and alcohol lends point to a situation by no means confined to Brazil. It seems that, under pressure of economic necessity, and with the double view of aiding domestic agriculture and reducing petroleum imports, a number of nations have been encouraging or compelling the use of home products for motor fuel.

headline.main: URUGUAY VOTE DROPS.; 130,000 Ballots Cast -- Aids Foes of Board Rule.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: November was the fifth consecutive month to show a gain in the gold stocks of the United States, due to movements of the metal since the outward movement of the metal on a large scale ended in mid-June. The gain, amounting to $68,520,200, exceeded...
docs.lead_paragraph: November was the fifth consecutive month to show a gain in the gold stocks of the United States, due to movements of the metal since the outward movement of the metal on a large scale ended in mid-June. The gain, amounting to $68,520,200, exceeded that of the previous month, principally because of large releases of gold earmarked here for foreign account.

headline.main: $68,520,200 GAIN IN GOLD IN MONTH; Fifth Consecutive Rise Due to Movements of the Metal Shown in November. IMPORTS $16,555,200 HERE Exports $8,600 -- San Francisco Received $3,408,000 -- Decrease of $48,565,600 in Earmark.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 -- Secretary Stimson presided as host at the farewell luncheon given today in the Hall of the Patriots of the Pan American Union by the members of the governing board, of which he is chairman, for Don Miguel Cruchaga Tocornal, retiring Ambassador of Chile.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 -- United States merchandise exports in October were larger in the case of thirty-two of the thirty-nine principal foreign markets as compared with the praceding month, and larger import were received from twenty-seven foreign...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 -- United States merchandise exports in October were larger in the case of thirty-two of the thirty-nine principal foreign markets as compared with the praceding month, and larger import were received from twenty-seven foreign countries, the Commerce Department reported today.

headline.main: EXPORTS IN OCTOBER LARGER TO 32 LANDS; Imports During the Month From 27 Foreign Countries Gained Over September Totals. BRITAIN BEST CUSTOMER Oceania Only One of Grand Divi- sions Where Trade in Both Groups Showed Decline.

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Dec. 7. -- Carefully explaining that they were not passing judgment, the four great powers of the League of Nations gave their views today on the Lytton report's findings on Manchuria to the special Assembly.

docs.snippet: The revolutionizing fervor of the Spanish Republic recently came into conflict with the American Government over Spain's proposal to abrogate the national telephone contract. The extent to which the revolutionary movement is sweeping over Spain is...
docs.lead_paragraph: The revolutionizing fervor of the Spanish Republic recently came into conflict with the American Government over Spain's proposal to abrogate the national telephone contract. The extent to which the revolutionary movement is sweeping over Spain is set forth in the following article.
docs.abstract: Feature article on revolutionary movement and creation of new order; illus

headline.main: SPAIN IN REVOLUTIONARY ARDOR SWEEPS AWAY OLD INSTITUTIONS; The Republic, Determined to Rebuild on an Entirely New Basis, Ruthlessly Destroys the Work of Centuries Under the Old Order
